data.text:
Customers find the storyline exceptional, compelling, and interesting. They also appreciate the history lesson and find the book informative and fun.

"It was very interesting to read. Want to see the movie now" Read more

"...This book is certainly worth reading if only to see the way our legal process actually works...." Read more

"This was a great book. Had a hard time putting it down.Finished it in 3 days." Read more

"Amazing storytelling book about a city that was proud, indiferent and arrogant, gracious to strangers but immune to their charms, and liked things..." Read more

Customers find the writing quality of the book well written, vivid, and easy to understand. They also mention that the accounts of his four trials are well done and the author has a remarkable ability to describe settings, characters, and all that makes Savannah, and Charleston.

"...Each chapter, when taken on its own, is well-written and engaging...." Read more

"Well written and fun to read even if youâ€™re NOT planning a visit to Savannah. And I recommend both the book and the visit." Read more

"I thought John Berendt did a very good job of weaving a rich tapestry of eccentric characters and a fascinating setting, into an original true crime..." Read more

"I liked this book. There's A lot of interesting characters in this book, some real and some fictional, but interesting anyway." Read more

"Great character development and was a great boost to Savannahâ€™s tourism starting in the nineties. Like most books, better than the movie." Read more

Customers find the setting fascinating, splendid, and romantic. They also appreciate the psychological portrayal and historical perspective. Readers also mention the book is well-written, bringing the city and its people to life.

"...job of weaving a rich tapestry of eccentric characters and a fascinating setting, into an original true crime story...." Read more

"Great character development and was a great boost to Savannahâ€™s tourism starting in the nineties. Like most books, better than the movie." Read more

"...There are fascinating descriptions of voodoo rituals being used to influence the trial. I suppose it does contain a lot of bestseller..." Read more

"Have you ever wanted to read something you knew would be rich, fascinating and true? I read Midnight in the Garden shortly after it was published...." Read more

Customers find the book has an accurate depiction of the rich cultural and architectural world of Savannah. They also appreciate the fun characters and the ribbon of color commentary on Savannah culture. Readers also mention the book provides a slice of history from a very unique perspective.

"...It was just interesting and endearing and wonderful.And what's it about? It's about Savannah...." Read more

"...on several of the people portrayed in this book and thus picture them with perfect clarity...." Read more

"...That said it is still charming, funny, interesting & a good read. I think a trip to Savannah is in order ðŸ˜‰..." Read more

Customers have mixed opinions about the entertainment value of the book. Some find it entertaining, bringing back good memories, and hooking them. They also appreciate the humor, charm, style, and quirks. However, others say that it's not very interesting, a great waste of taxpayers money, and poorly written.

"...How the story unfolds is as fascinating as it is entertaining. Midnight is definitely something that could only happen in Savannah...." Read more

"I liked this story but it was not as good as I had anticipated...." Read more

"...Each chapter, when taken on its own, is well-written and engaging...." Read more

Customers are mixed about the plot. Some find the book holds their interest with intrigue, mystery, and great writing. However, others find the storyline disjointed, quirky, and lacking cohesiveness in parts of the book.

"...The book is a fascinating murder mystery, set in a fascinating town, with an array of exotic characters...." Read more

"...book because it was a best seller and supposedly put an interesting spin on a murder mystery...." Read more

"...of the novel to be kind of hard to get into, and the storyline was all over the place, with many different characters who didnâ€™t seem to be part of..." Read more

"...doesn't lag, the characters are interesting, and the murder case is just fascinating. I recommended the book to my friends, I enjoyed it that much!" Read more

Customers are mixed about the reading pace. Some find the book fast, comfortable, and southern. They also appreciate the pleasant flow and the author's writing style. However, others say the book is a bit slow paced.

"...Though this is non-fiction, it reads like a novel. The story doesn't lag, the characters are interesting, and the murder case is just fascinating...." Read more

"...It is a little bit laborious and slow but I found it worth it in the end" Read more
